intro: Palicourea triphylla, commonly known as the three-leafed palicourea, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
